title: MURDER ON THE HIGH SEAS
description: Detective Logico took a cruise to relax. But when the ship's bartender was found dead, his vacation became work. At least the ocean views were still nice.

suspects.name: CAPTAIN NEPTUNE
suspects.description: He has sailed the seven seas and sunk three ships. His passengers love him, but his crew fears him. He steers the ship like he steers conversations - badly.

suspects.name: CHEF MARINA
suspects.description: She cooks five-star meals in a tiny kitchen. Her knife skills are perfect, and her temper is worse. She hates when people complain about the food.

suspects.name: RICH PASSENGER CORAL
suspects.description: She owns three houses and two yachts. This cruise is cheap fun for her. She tips badly and treats staff like servants.

weapons.name: A LIFE PRESERVER
weapons.description: Supposed to save lives, not end them. This one is heavy enough to knock someone overboard forever.

weapons.name: A GALLEY KNIFE
weapons.description: Sharp enough to cut through frozen fish. Also sharp enough to cut through excuses and alibis.

weapons.name: AN ANCHOR CHAIN
weapons.description: Keeps the ship from floating away. Could also keep a person from floating away, permanently.

locations.name: THE DINING HALL
locations.description: Where passengers eat fancy food and complain about everything. The waiters smile, but their eyes show pain.

locations.name: THE UPPER DECK
locations.description: Perfect for watching sunsets and throwing things overboard. The ocean is deep and keeps secrets well.

locations.name: THE ENGINE ROOM
locations.description: Hot, loud, and full of dangerous machines. Only crew members are allowed down here for good reasons.

clues: The person with the life preserver was seen on the upper deck during dinner time.
Chef Marina never leaves her galley knife unattended - she brings it everywhere she goes.
Only Captain Neptune has keys to the engine room, and only he goes there.
Rich Passenger Coral was complaining loudly about her dinner in the dining hall.
Either the galley knife was in the dining hall, or the anchor chain was in the engine room.
The bartender's body was found floating next to the ship with rope burns on his neck.
